intro: Platanaria natans, commonly known as the floating bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its rootless, floating stems and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are typically whorled and have a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Platanaria natans plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by both preying on microorganisms and serving as a food source for larger aquatic animals.
